--- layout: default title: "OHBM 2011: Introduction to Imaging Genetics" ---
Listed below are all available talks from the OHBM 2011 "Introduction to Imaging Genetics" workshop.

Organized by:
Thomas Nichols, University of Warwick and Jean-Baptiste Poline, Neurospin

Description

This course will introduce the fundamentals of "Imaging Genetics," the process of modeling and understanding genetic variation in brain image data. The course begins with a four-lecture genetics tutorial in the morning, designed to give imaging practitioners a quick overview of key genetics concepts and terminology. The remainder of the course covers how imagers can use genetic variables in their analyses. Specific topics include voxel-wise genome-wide models, joint multivariate modeling of imaging and genetic data, and heritability analyses of cortical surface and thickness data. The course concludes with two case studies highlighting current imaging genetics research.

Talks

  • Molecular basis of genetic variation
    Authors: Thomas Nichols, Trygve Bakken.
  • Imaging Genetics: The Example of Schizophrenia
    Author: Tyrone D. Cannon.
  • Determining Genetic Effects: Heritability, Linkage & Association
    Author: David C. Glahn.
  • Multivariate Phenotypes for association and linkage
    Author: Peter Kochunov.
  • Structure and Analysis of Genetic Variation
    Author: Fabio Macciardi.
  • Imaging Genetics of Alzheimer's Disease: The ADNI Experience
    Author: Andrew J. Saykin.
  • Univariate Approaches: Multiple Testing & Voxelwise Whole Genome Association
    Author: Jason L. Stein.
  • Multivariate Approaches: Joint Modeling of Imaging and Genetic Data
    Author: Bertrand Thirion.
  • Overview of neuroimaging phenotypes
    Authors: Herve Lemaitre, Roberto Toro.
